children.subject: I haven't taken 143, but I have taken 130 and have some microfabrication knowledge, and I would say that your background should be sufficient. Basically a good understanding of physics fundamentals at the level of Physics 7B is all that should be needed. I know that 143 is a very applied course, without an excessive focus on theory, so background reading probably isn't necessary either. If you really want to, you could take a look at Prof. Chenming Hu's notes / textbook available on his website, or read through the University of Colorado's online Semiconductor Device Physics notes for background semiconductor knowledge, but I certainly wouldn't bother myself.

history.content: Hi, I am planning to enroll in EE143 but I have not yet taken 16B. I have completed Physics 7B. Can anyone who has taken 143 please offer me some advice? Would it be okay to take 143 without 16B, and what material should I review/self study for 143 beforehand? Thank you
history.subject: EE143 without EE16B
